answers.answer: HiNeuropathy is a disease of the nerves. It is of two types central and peripheral. Are you having the symptoms in either of your limbs? If so, then it could be peripheral neuropathy. It can result from a lot of causes: diabetes, trauma, vitamin deficiency, toxins, renal or liver disease.You should consult your doctor about the cause of neuropathy as it is important to treat the underlying disorder.Do write in if you need more information.Regards

question: I am a 34 year old obese woman.  I have had depression for as long as I can remember.  Now, I got a phone call from the doctor that the test results say I have neuropathy.  I have the nausea, numbness, tingling, fatigue, lower back pain, insomnia, etc.  What to do now?This discussion is related tohttp://www.medhelp.org/posts/show/294717.
title: new diagnosis
